result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rebecca L. Sobotka in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Keith Venema for Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Rebecca L. Sobotka.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Reading of complaint waived. Rights given and preliminary hearing requested within time period. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Rebecca L. Sobotka in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Rebecca L. Sobotka.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Charges/penalties explained by the court. Set over for complaint to be gone over with client. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Rebecca L. Sobotka in court, in custody by video.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Bradley Lochowicz appeared. Attorney Lochowicz not yet appointed on this case. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

BOND TO COVER 22GF1072 & 22CF212

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any co-actor(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  CO-ACTOR(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH CO-ACTORS ERIC GARNER AND ABBEY ROCKTEACHER.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH K.B. dob 3-5-1984. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 
22-4873,22-4874

Called at 1:34 PM. Defendant Rebecca L Sobotka in court, in custody by video. Samuel Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Grace Hagerman appeared for bond purposes. Defendant is eligible for SPD representation. Discussion as to bond. Defendant is on P.O. hold. Court sets total bond with same conditions plus added no contact condition. Dates in 22CF212 remain. Prior bond forfeited. Minutes filed. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
